intro: Brassia chlorops, commonly known as the green-stem orchid, is a species of orchid native to South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique greenish stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking yellow and green flowers that bloom in clusters during the warmer months. Brassia chlorops thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for collectors and enthusiasts of tropical flora.
